title: Literary landmarks of Edinburgh,
author: Hutton, Laurence
snippet: In " Home's Life and Letters " no hint is given as to his Edinburgh abiding-place. He died there, at a ripe old age, in 1808, and was buried in the yard of South Leith Parish Church, on the outer wall of which, on the south side, is a tablet with a simple inscription to his memory. It is visible, but not legible, from Kirkgate Street.
